member.name: T:JSON_RPC_Server.Interceptor
member.summary: Server-side request interceptor. An Interceptor allows to intercept incoming JSON-RPC requests as well as JSON-RPC responses.

member.name: M:JSON_RPC_Server.Interceptor.interceptRequest(AustinHarris.JsonRpc.JsonRequest)
member.summary: Intercept an incoming JSON-RPC request before being processed.
member.returns: a response for this request, or null if the response should be generated by handling the request

member.name: M:JSON_RPC_Server.Interceptor.interceptResponse(AustinHarris.JsonRpc.JsonRequest,AustinHarris.JsonRpc.JsonResponse)
member.summary: Intercept a response before sending it back to the caller.
member.param: the request that has been handled
the response that has been generated by handling the request

member.name: T:JSON_RPC_Server.ServiceMode
member.summary: Enumeration of the modes in which JSON-RPC requests shall be processed.

member.name: F:JSON_RPC_Server.ServiceMode.RELIABLE
member.summary: Process requests in a reliable way, i.e. without disconnections, interruptions, crashes, or alike.

member.name: F:JSON_RPC_Server.ServiceMode.DISCONNECT_BEFORE_PROCESSING
member.summary: Close the connection before handling the request in any way. Please note that no interceptor will be called in this mode.

member.name: F:JSON_RPC_Server.ServiceMode.DISCONNECT_BEFORE_REPLY
member.summary: Close the connection after having processed the request, but before sending back the response. Please note that in this mode, the interceptor will be called for both the request as well as the response.

member.name: F:JSON_RPC_Server.ServiceMode.RANDOM
member.summary: The service mode will be determined randomly for every subsequent request. This includes all three other modes, i.e. RELIABLE, DISCONNECT_BEFORE_PROCESSING, and DISCONNECT_BEFORE_REPLY. Please note that by definition of the two latter modes, the connection will be closed in those cases. If the randomly selected service mode is RELIABLE, however, the next request will be handled in a reliable fashion, keeping the connection alive. For each subsequent request, a service mode will again be chosen randomly.
